title: Circuits - capacitor charge vs potential diff

content.description: A student determines the charge on one plate of an air-filled, parallel-plate capacitor for several values of the potential difference across the capacitor plates. The student creates the graph shown, which plots capacitor charge as a function of potential difference. The slope of the best-fit line is <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"> <mi>m</mi> </math>. The student then fills the capacitor with a material with dielectric constant <math alttext="kappa equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mi>Îº</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and repeats the procedure.
content.question: If the student created a graph of capacitor charge as a function of potential difference for the capacitor with the dielectric material, what would be the slope of the best-fit line?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
